view Package¶

vtk_utils Module¶

view.vtk_utils.add_HklPlane_with_orientation_in_grain(grain)¶
view.vtk_utils.add_hklplane_to_grain(hklplane, grid, euler, origin=(0, 0, 0))¶
view.vtk_utils.add_plane_to_grid(plane, grid, origin)¶

vtk helper function to add a plane inside another object described by a mesh (vtkunstructuredgrid). The method is to use a vtkCutter with the mesh as input and the plane as the cut function. An actor in returned. This may be used directly to add hkl planes inside a lattice cell.

view.vtk_utils.apply_orientation_to_actor(actor, euler)¶
view.vtk_utils.ask_for_map_file(dir, scan_name)¶
view.vtk_utils.axes_actor(length=1.0, axisLabels=True)¶
view.vtk_utils.contourByDiscreteMarchingCubes(data, value, color='grey', diffuseColor='grey', opacity=1.0)¶
view.vtk_utils.data_outline(data, corner=False, color=(0.0, 0.0, 0.0))¶

vtk helper function to draw a bounding box around a volume.

view.vtk_utils.gray_cmap(table_range=(0, 255))¶

create a black and white colormap.

view.vtk_utils.grid_vol_view(scan)¶
view.vtk_utils.hot_cmap(table_range=(0, 255))¶

create a look up table similar to matlab’s hot.

view.vtk_utils.lattice_3d(grid, tubeRadius=0.02, sphereRadius=0.1)¶
view.vtk_utils.lattice_grid(lattice)¶
view.vtk_utils.pv_rand_cmap(N=256, first_is_black=False)¶

write out the random color map in paraview xml format.

view.vtk_utils.rand_cmap(N=256, first_is_black=False, table_range=(0, 255))¶

create a look up table with random color. The first color can be enforced to black and usually figure out the background. The random seed is fixed to consistently produce the same colormap.

view.vtk_utils.read_image_data(file_name, size, data_type='uint8')¶

vtk helper function to read a 3d data file. The size is needed in the form (x, y, z) as well a string describing the data type in numpy format (uint8 is assumed by default). Lower file left and little endian are assumed.

view.vtk_utils.render(ren, ren_size=(600, 600), display=True, name='render_3d.png')¶
view.vtk_utils.to_vtk_type(type)¶
view.vtk_utils.unit_arrow_3d(start, vector)¶
view.vtk_utils.vol_view(scan)¶

wxPlotPanel Module¶

class view.wxPlotPanel.PlotPanel(parent, color=None, dpi=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: wx._windows.Panel

The PlotPanel has a Figure and a Canvas. OnSize events simply set a flag, and the actual resizing of the figure is triggered by an Idle event.

SetColor(rgbtuple=None)¶

Set figure and canvas colours to be the same.

draw()¶
